definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: But this is simply eyewash to cover the lack of real reform.
sentences.chinese: 但这只是掩盖缺乏真正改革的表面文章。

sentences.english: The twentieth rule is that you must understand that eyewash is constructive.
sentences.chinese: 第二十条必须懂得表面文章的建设性。

sentences.english: Yes, President Hamid Karzai is a Pashtun, but that's window dressing.
sentences.chinese: 虽然卡尔扎伊总统是普什图人，但那只是表面文章。

sentences.english: Boinking the lawyer is just icing on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 跟律师乱搞不过是表面文章而已。

sentences.english: After this event, people who are depressed will get depressed again. It's all superficial.
sentences.chinese: 沮丧的人继续沮丧，那些都是表面文章”。

sentences.english: H is political commitment is only skin- deep.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上的承诺只是表面文章。

sentences.english: He was merely paying lip service.
sentences.chinese: 他那番话不过是表面文章。

definition: lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to be all talk and no action
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to do sth for show/to keep up appearances
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
